column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Tanin (Afghanistan): I thank you, Madam\r
#Text=President, for organizing such an important meeting,\r
#Text=and congratulations on your leadership of the Council\r
#Text=this month.
#Text=I would also like to thank previous speakers\r
#Text=for their statements and the Secretary-General for\r
#Text=his recent report (S/2014/693) on women and peace\r
#Text=and security.
#Text=I look forward to his global study of\r
#Text=the implementation of resolution 1325 (2000) and the\r
#Text=upcoming high-level review of the resolution.
#Text=This debate could not have come at a more timely\r
#Text=moment.
#Text=War and conflict affect more lives today - all\r
#Text=over the world, but particularly in Afghanistan and\r
#Text=the wider region - than at any time in recent history.
#Text=Millions of families have been forced to flee their\r
#Text=homes, and millions of women and children have been\r
#Text=left vulnerable, bearing the brunt of the burden of those\r
#Text=tragic circumstances.
#Text=The people of Afghanistan, particularly women\r
#Text=and girls, have suffered immensely as a result of\r
#Text=almost 40 years of war and conflict.
#Text=The violence in\r
#Text=my country has shattered their lives, interrupted their\r
#Text=educations, threatened their livelihoods, destroyed\r
#Text=their communities and pushed them from their homes\r
#Text=to other countries or to unfamiliar cities and slums.
#Text=Afghanistan's refugee situation remains the largest\r
#Text=protracted such situation in the world, and this year\r
#Text=the number of internally displaced persons (IDPs) has\r
#Text=increased due to a resurgence of insecurity in parts\r
#Text=of the country.
#Text=Women suffer disproportionately in\r
#Text=situations of displacement.
#Text=They often lack access\r
#Text=to the most basic services and resources and are at a\r
#Text=higher risk of discrimination and human rights abuses.
#Text=In the past year, there has been a rise in the violent\r
#Text=activities of the Taliban, terrorists groups and other\r
#Text=anti-Government armed opposition and the greatest\r
#Text=increase in civilian deaths ofthe past 13 years, including\r
#Text=many of women and girls.
#Text=The Taliban and other\r
#Text=anti-Government elements continue to launch targeted\r
#Text=attacks and intimidation campaigns against women\r
#Text=from all spectrums of society, from schoolgirls to\r
#Text=female leaders, including women police officers, human\r
#Text=rights defenders, media personnel and politicians.
#Text=Insecurity has also hampered the Government's ability\r
#Text=to prosecute human rights abusers and uphold the rule\r
#Text=of law, thereby exacerbating women's vulnerability\r
#Text=to sexual and gender-based violence, domestic abuse,\r
#Text=harassment, forced marriage and other crimes.
#Text=Despite those challenges, Afghanistan has arrived\r
#Text=at an important turning point that offers tremendous\r
#Text=opportunity for strengthened progress on the women\r
#Text=and peace and security agenda.
#Text=Last month, the new\r
#Text=President was inaugurated, representing the first\r
#Text=democratic transition from one elected president to the\r
#Text=next in the country's history.
#Text=In this year's presidential\r
#Text=and provincial council elections, millions of women\r
#Text=participated as voters, and hundreds played a significant\r
#Text=role as candidates and as campaigners, despite facing\r
#Text=threats and intimidation.
#Text=Their involvement set the tone\r
#Text=for an Afghanistan in which women participate and\r
#Text=contribute equally to the country's future.
#Text=President Ghani Ahmadzai and the national unity\r
#Text=Government are committed to women's full and\r
#Text=equal participation at all levels of governance and\r
#Text=decision-making.
#Text=The President made that clear in his\r
#Text=inaugural address, in which he pledged to promote\r
#Text=women's advancement in Afghanistan and praised his\r
#Text=wife, Rula Ghani, for the role she would play as an\r
#Text=active public figure dedicated to promoting women's\r
#Text=rights.
#Text=This gesture is a first for our young democracy.
#Text=Just a few days ago, Afghanistan signed the women\r
#Text=and peace and security national action plan, which aims\r
#Text=to make progress on the four main areas ofparticipation,\r
#Text=protection, conflict prevention and relief and recovery.
#Text=We appreciate the Government of Finland's support for\r
#Text=the development of the plan and remain committed to\r
#Text=implementing the women and peace and security agenda\r
#Text=through key institutions and the national action plan for\r
#Text=the women of Afghanistan.
#Text=We are also dedicated to\r
#Text=promoting the participation of women in the security\r
#Text=sector and aim to increase the number of women police\r
#Text=officers from the current 2,230 to 10,000 by 2017.
#Text=As Afghanistan prepares for the full transfer\r
#Text=of security responsibility from international to\r
#Text=Afghan forces at the end of 2014, the President and\r
#Text=new leadership of the country are committed to a\r
#Text=comprehensive reform agenda.
#Text=Over the next two\r
#Text=years, Afghanistan will hold district and parliamentary\r
#Text=elections, reform electoral laws, convene a loya jirga to\r
#Text=consider amendments to the Constitution and conduct\r
#Text=a reinvigorated outreach and reconciliation process\r
#Text=with the armed opposition.
#Text=Throughout, the active role\r
#Text=of all segments of the Afghan population, particularly\r
#Text=Afghan women, will be essential.
#Text=The Government of\r
#Text=Afghanistan believes adamantly that their participation\r
#Text=is critical to preserving and enhancing the gains of the\r
#Text=past 12 years and to the future stability, democracy,\r
#Text=prosperity and peace of the country.
#Text=In that regard,\r
#Text=the international community's continued support for\r
#Text=Afghanistan's efforts to advance women's rights and\r
#Text=status remains crucial.
#Text=Afghan women have suffered immensely as a\r
#Text=result of Taliban rule, extremism and decades of war.
#Text=Only when they are free from violence, want and fear\r
#Text=will we be able to secure stability and lasting peace\r
#Text=in Afghanistan.
#Text=For those reasons, we welcome the\r
#Text=opportunities provided to us by the upcoming twentieth\r
#Text=anniversary of the Beijing Conference on Women, the\r
#Text=fifteenth anniversary of resolution 1325 (2000) and the\r
#Text=adoption of the sustainable development goals to make\r
#Text=further progress on the issue of women and peace and\r
#Text=security, and the agenda for women in Afghanistan and\r
#Text=for women around the world.
